name: Hilton Dubai Creek

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff and rooms are the winners here . Cleanest rooms I have ever seen . Breakfast selection in lounge is dreadful and strangely they will not allow you to have the choice to have it in the main restaurant as per ALL other Hilton's we have stayed at. Location is great for old Dubai and metro 10 minutes away . Dubai is so spread out so it's location was great unless you want a beach holiday. Faults were slow lifts and poor exec breakfast . Evening in lounge was sensational as were the staff.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel lived up to its reviews and proved to be a great choice for our weeks holiday in Dubai. I was a little hesitant staying so far from the beach (about 20mins away by taxi or complimentary shuttle bus), but as it was we only had one day on the beach anyway as there is so much to do and see in Dubai on your first trip there and Deira is a great base for exploring the city.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent staff

reviews.text: The staff could not have been more attentive, and one of our room attendants even wrote us a letter to introduce himself (David), and left a bath bomb for my wife to use, two chocolates each etc etc.
reviews.title: Business and good for relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was excellent value overall, however I would prefer that they up the rates slightly and provide free wifi throughout to all it's guests as internet access should not be an additional extra (£10 per hour) within hotels in this day and age.
reviews.title: Third visit and will be back

reviews.text: The only other slight criticism would be the size of the bathrobes, they must be designed for children! However it was quite amusing sitting by the lovely pool on the roof and watching people trying to put on these miniature dressing gowns. Strangely enough they were normal size in their sister hotel by the beach.
reviews.title: Bright staff from around Asia
Fantastic
reviews.text: There is not one thing I would change about this hotel. Just in case you are booking for a break here are some things you might need to know;

reviews.title: Worth a second trip!
reviews.text: The hotel offers complimentary beach transfers twice daily and use of the Hilton hotel at Jumeriah beach, a good way to get to Wild Wadi, Burj al Arab etc cheaply. It takes about 25mins to get there.
The hotel is quite central to everywhere, virtually in the middle of Dubai, you need to get a taxi to most places however we never paid more than about £7 (to the Mall of the Emirates I think)
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Don't take the trips, desert safari etc from thehotel, you can get exactly the same trips for half the price if you ring the numbers in Time Out etc, which they have free in the rooms!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Eat in the Glasshouse restaurant, the food is great, the service is great and the prices are very reasonable.
reviews.title: Boring !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel from Boxing Day until New Year's Eve 2006. We had booked an Executive Room, and the free pick up from the airport went very smoothly. We checked into our room and we were a little disappointed to find out it was next to the lift shaft. As such, the bathroom did not have a bath in it (just a shower) and the room was a strange shape. We asked at reception if it was possible to change rooms and the following evening we were contacted by the Executive Lounge receptionist and offered another, better room. This room had a bath and was a better room overall.
reviews.title: Good hotel but book early for trips!

likes.liked: — It was extremely clean and modern.
likes.disliked: — The room next to the lift shaft.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in Verre one night, although that nearly did not happen because we realised about an hour before we due to dine that it was a "dry" day in Dubai and the restaurant was not open - despite us having a booking confirmed by the restaurant manager! After a few enquiries, and speaking to the General Manager it was confirmed that we had a booking for the following night - but we had not been told this originally! As a result we got a free glass of champagne and desserts in the restaurant. We thought the restaurant was excellent.
reviews.title: It's OK but we wouldn't go back

likes.liked: — It was close to other hotels so we could get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried to book a couple of trips through the hotel concierge, but were disappointed to find out that they were booked up. The one we had particularly wanted to go on was the trip to the Godolphin stables. I had e-mailed the hotel about this trip some weeks before we travelled and they said it would be ok to book when we arrived, but sadly this did not work out. The stables tour was fully booked for the following 2 weeks! If you would like to go on this tour do not wait until you arrive to book it!
reviews.title: The mediocre Dubai Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are glad we did not stay down at the beach, as it looked like a complete construction site. Taxis are so cheap to get around in, but the traffic is appalling!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but stay nearer the beach!
Dubai's finest "city hotel"
reviews.text: We booked here for 6 nights Dec 25 - Jan 31.

Had eaten at Glasshouse a couple of times on previous visits and always liked the look of this hotel. So when my friend and I decided to come for a weekend shopping trip from Pakistan where we live at the moment, it was my first choice. We got a free pick up from the airport and the driver was waiting with my name on a board. We checked in at the Executive lounge and had tea and smoked salmon sandwiches whilst the receptionist went through the formalities. We had asked for a twin room which wasn't available on the Executive floor so we were given a room on a lower floor but still had access to the Executive lounge. The room was lovely, twin beds facing a wall of glass looking down the creek and out to sea in the distance. The bathroom was gorgeous - a big bath, huge separate shower, all in black and grey marble and granite and a complimentary rubber duck. Our room was very quiet and the beds were comfy so we got a good nights sleep following our mega-shopping trips! The location is good - City Centre mall is a short taxi ride away (walkable at a pinch) and M&S, Toys R Us, Reef Mall, Al Ghurain mall and the gold souk are all pretty close as well. On all but one occasion we managed to get a taxi almost straight away outside the hotel, although the odd driver would refuse to take us when he realised we weren't going far - one pretended he didn't know where the gold souk was! The hotel also has a complimentary shuttle bus to a different shopping mall once each day.
reviews.title: LOVED IT!

likes.disliked: — small pool area which on the Saturday was very busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was served in Glasshouse and was very good - hot dishes such as bacon and eggs, french toast, pancakes, eggs benedict etc are ordered a la carte and served directly to you. We had dinner in the Glasshouse one night and as ever it was excellent. The executive lounge serves tea, coffee, cold drinks and snacks all day and from 6 to 8pm has "happy hour" with wine, spirits and beer plus hot snacks, houmus, cheeses, etc. Only complaint is it is very small and gets busy at happy hour so you have to get there early to get a seat! Staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful and housekeeping replenish towels and toiletries in the evening when they do the turn down service. I really couldn't fault this hotel, it was a fab experience from the moment we were picked up at the airport to being dropped off there again 3 nights later.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in an amazing city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel and can't fault it. We were checked into our room immediately, even though we had arrived early following an overnight flight. The room was superb, looking out over the creek and offering every luxury you could require.
reviews.title: Good Location, Good Service
Perfect Location, away from building sites
reviews.text: We used the glasshouse restaurant for breakfast and dinner, all meals were fresh and delicious and served by excellent waiting staff. Room service was also quick and very reasonably priced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping were also excellent, whenever you requested anything, it was brought to your room immediately.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Dubai Creek for 5 nights. Welcomed as a Diamond honors, and was escorted up to the executive lounge for check-in and received an upgrade to an executive floor room. What a treat! Great room with a great view of the creek. Plenty of storage space in the room. Breakfast in the exective lounge was very good, and in the evening they had good light snacks. The location worked well for us. It was relatively close to the airport, and in the old part of Dubai. From the hotel, there was about a 5 minute walk to the water-bus that runs every 12 minutes and takes you up the creek to the old souks for just 4AED. To get to the train station, that was about a 10 minute walk; and the train takes you to all the major locations in new Dubai. If you're visiting Dubai for the beaches, this is not the location for you. If you're visiting to see Dubai, and experience the older parts and the creek, this is the location for you. The hotel is first rate, and the service, and the employees are excellent.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: In full disclosure, I am a Hilton Gold member and used points to pay for this hotel. Dubai is an expensive city. While I didn't think the cost for this hotel was that bad, this was the final stay on an 8 day trip and didn't feel like spending any more money. With that being said, this hotel is very nice and for the price I would have paid, a great value for any tourist going to Dubai. After coming from the Four Seasons in Mumbai, I have to see the hotel had comparable service.
reviews.title: Dependable Hotel in a Big City

reviews.text: Dubai is a large city and very spread out. You will likely have to take a taxi anywhere you go, whether it is the many malls, tourist sites, or incredible restaurants. I originally had a room booked at the Ritz at DIFC, and while I did walk through the hotel, it was incredible, you may have been close to one site, but would have to cab to all others. This hotel is close to the souks, about a 15 minute walk. Everything else you will have to cab to. At the end of the day, this is the perfect place to dock while you explore. For business, I would have no problem working in this room all day.
reviews.title: Excellent
Mani exceeds expectations
reviews.text: The hotel itself was great. I received compimentary breakfast and it was outstanding. I also had a 1am flight out, they allowed me to check my bags with the hotel and use the health club to shower before I went on my flight and did not have to pay for an extra night that I wouldn't have used. The service is outstanding. The concierge arranged a car and driver for me to do a day trip to see Abu Dhabi and what I felt was a very reasonable rate. There are plenty of taxis outside the hotel, both fixed fare and metered fare.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice of which I have attached a photo. It had several electrical outlets, a safe, great bathroom, firm bed, and a nice view of Dubai Creek. The pool is on the roof (14th floor), and while small, gives you a great view of the Dubai Creek a long with the skyline to see the Burj Khalifa, if you can tolerate the smog. The Executive Lounge is nice and has a patio as well. When I was comparing rates, you could pay a small upcharge for royalty treatment and still be 50% under a base price for other "luxury" hotels.
reviews.title: Extreme disappointment

reviews.text: I'm one of those people who earns my Hhonors status the hard way; by actually completing the required stays in a year, and not just given it by a fast track promo or credit card perk. That's why I rarely stay at Hilton properties in the US, as you simply don't get any kind of recognition as they hand our Gold/Diamond cards like sweeties.
reviews.title: Got Hhonors status? This is one of the best properties...

reviews.text: Here, it's very different.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: My status was recognised on check in and I was greeted and welcomed as a Hhonors member. My room was then upgraded to an exec suite, which was a very nice touch; wrap around balcony with distant sea views. It wasn't the upgrade which made this stay, however, it was the staff.
reviews.title: Ok hotel with great views

reviews.text: Only in one other Hilton property (Abu Dhabi Hilton) have I ever experienced such genuinely helpful and eager-to-please staff members. Nothing seemed too much for them, and from the doorman to the concierge to the exec lounge bar staff, everyone had a smile and a friendly greeting; not always the case in business-orientated hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent property, poorly managed.

reviews.text: I think if you don't have Hhonors status then the extra charges like wifi, breakfast, etc. might add up too quickly to make this a good value stay, but if you're Gold or Diamond then it's a great business hotel. I'll be putting all my future stays in Dubai over to this hotel, rather than the Sheraton where I've stayed until now.
reviews.title: Quoise.
7 out of 10
reviews.text: showed up at 5 in the morning due to flights and they wouldn't let me check in even though they had clean rooms available. instead i had to sit around the lobby for 3 hours then at 8 they finally let me check in. but that aside, the rooms were nice and modern though needed some maintenance. the bathtubs in two rooms that i was in didn't work for instance. far from everything but dubai is very spread out and you are never where you want to be. the taxis are super cheap and given the price that i paid for this hotel was really good i would stay again. the only other place i would think about staying is a hotel along the water if i felt like shelling out the money.
oh, and the pool was pretty spectacular. see picture!
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — A camp bed and a small executive lounge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week during October and found it really difficult to fault the hotel. The staff, as is so often the case, are the greatest asset a hotel can have and the staff at the Dubai Creek Hilton were a cut above so many we have previously encountered. Within a couple of days we were being addressed by name, the staff at breakfast reserved a regular table for us and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Very good but watch the sting in Ramsays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation was very good. we stayed on the thirteenth floor with marvellous views of the dhow wharf and the creek and were near enough to the roof top pool to walk up the stairs, where, although it is fairly compact there was always enough space and, although it was Ramadan, there was a screened area for the service of refreshments, most welcome in average day time temperatures of 36C.
reviews.title: We really enjoyed the Hilton Dubai Creek

likes.liked: — If you are a Hilton Honours member - you can only earn points if you book directly with the Hilton. We booked through a travel agents and didn't get any points!

reviews.text: The room itself was large by any standards, with floor to ceiling windows and a large bathroom. The only gripe in this respect was that we had been sold the room as a triple. What this in fact meant was that a 'camp bed', was provided. Luckily the third member of our party is quite petite and managed OK, but it was effectively only suitable for a child or small adult . I suggest that if you intend to book a triple or quad room you check what exactly you are getting (we booked through BA holidays).
reviews.title: beware- rude unhelpful staff

reviews.text: I have stayed at many of the hotels in Dubai. This Hilton has a fantastic staff at reception that will go out of their way to assist you. Clayton (I hope thats right) resolved an issue for me without even being asked. The room category I reserved was the King Executive Plus and room 811 was outstanding. It offers panoramic water views with 2 full walls of windows. The jetted tub overlooks the water as well. Its the small details-the bath salts, cute origami towel animals and notes from housekeeping(.."how was your day..?) that make it memorable. The downside to me was the unorganized staff in the executive lounge and being bombarded to sign in while balancing drink & food that caught me by surprise. But, even though a little unpolished, they still carried a smile.
reviews.title: Beautiful room

reviews.text: Hotel is nothing special. Rooms are large, clean, nice bathrooms. The hotel is within walking distance of a fairly large mall, about 10 min. The Sooks aren't too far in the other direction, probably about a 8 dollar cab ride. It is true there aren't really any stores or restaurants around the hotel. You will have to pay for internet wireless and anything else you might decide to use around the hotel. I will say the breakfast buffet is awesome, it is expensive but really good for about $25. As for training, there are some pretty decent commercial treadmills in the fitness centre to include as well some up to 40lb dumbells and a multi-station fitness structure with chin bar. It was chilly when I was there so didn't spend much time in the rooftop pool which has a gorgeous view of the city. No hot tub, but can imagine in the summer it must be pretty hot up there. Additionally they have a nightly rooftop BBQ.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfriendly staff, biased.
reviews.title: Unfriendly staff

reviews.text: No public transport near hotel. Only taxi, but you'll Have to wait a very long time for a taxi! Hotel can't call for a taxi! There aren't a lot of shop, restaurants around the hotel.
reviews.title: Good for business (and for a short vacation)

reviews.text: The view from the roof top is nice.
reviews.title: Stay only if you have a high Patience Level.

description: TThe Hilton Dubai Creek’s rooms feature contemporary decor and stunning marble bathrooms. All of the rooms are equipped with a Hilton Serenity Bed and deluxe bedding, flat screen TVs and high speed internet access.The Hilton Dubai Creek offers a complimentary shuttle service to its sister hotel on Jumeirah Beach, where guests have access to the hotel’s beachside facilities. Or guests can relax in the rooftop swimming pool on site while enjoying views of the city, or exercise in the fully-equipped fitness centre.
